alert.note: Alert for Christian; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:41PM EST until February 18 at 3:06AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CST FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following areas, Caldwell, Calloway, Christian, Hopkins, Lyon, Marshall, McLean, Muhlenberg, Todd and Trigg. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM CST, Flooding is likely ongoing from previous rainfall. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall has ended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hopkinsville, Madisonville, Murray, Oak Grove, Princeton, Central City, Benton, Dawson Springs, Cadiz, Eddyville, Elkton, Fort Campbell, Land Between The Lakes Area, Guthrie, Earlington, Nortonville, Pembroke, Mortons Gap, Crofton and Powderly. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
